mainMVC.model

Class MyChatRoom

  • java.lang.Object
    • mainMVC.model.MyChatRoom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IChatRoom, java.io.Serializable

    public class MyChatRoom
extends java.lang.Object
implements IChatRoom
    Represents a chat room or "conversation", an encapsulation of the IUsers involved in the conversation. Conceptually, essentially a dispatcher to a collection of of IUser stubs. Note that instances of this class is NOT Remote objects, that is, they are NOT an RMI server objects! Entire IChatRoom instances are sent to remote hosts, not stubs. one team is one chatroom
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • addLocalUser

        public void addLocalUser(IUser newUserStub)
        Locally add the given user to the chat room. This method does NOT add the user to the remote users' chatrooms. Assumes that an IAddUser datapacket was already sent out to all the current users in the chatroom.
        Specified by:
        addLocalUser in interface IChatRoom
        Parameters:
        newUserStub - The user stub to add to the chat room

      • removeLocalUser

        public void removeLocalUser(IUser userStub)
        Locally remove the given user from the chatroom. This method does NOT remove the user from the remote users' chatrooms.
        Specified by:
        removeLocalUser in interface IChatRoom
        Parameters:
        userStub - The user to remove from the chatroom

      • getUsers

        public java.lang.Iterable<IUser> getUsers()

        Specified by:
        getUsers in interface IChatRoom
        Returns:
